Description.val: The MH-60R Multi-Mission helicopter provides battle group protection and adds significant capability in coastal littorals and regional conflicts.  The MH-60R Multi-Mission Helicopter represents a significant avionics improvement to the H-60 series helicopters by enhancing primary mission areas of Undersea Warfare and Surface Warfare.  Airborne Low Frequency Sonar is added to enhance the existing acoustics suite.  An added Multi-Mode Radar includes an Inverse Synthetic Aperture Radar mode (permits stand-off classification of hostile threats).  An improved Electronics Surveillance Measures system will enable passive detection and targeting of radar sources not currently detectable.  Pre-Planned Product Improvements includes upgrades to communication, navigation, Identification Friend or Foe, Multi-Spectral Targeting System/Forward Looking Infrared, radar, weapons, data link, safety, maintenance, airframe and mission planning systems.

Justification.val:
FY2014 advance procurement funds are requested for procurement of FY2015 long lead items for avionics Contractor Furnished Equipment (CFE), miscellaneous other avionics, and Economic Order Quantity (EOQ)/termination liability (T.L.) for common cockpit, which is part of a Navy MH-60R and MH-60S Multiyear Procurement (MYP2) Mission Avionics/Common Cockpit contract for FY2012 - FY2016.  Also included in the FY2014 request is EOQ/T.L. in support of the MH-60R portion of a joint Army-Navy 5-year Multiyear Procurement (MYP8) contract for FY2012 - FY2016.

Common Cockpit/Mission Systems pricing reflects MYP2 award on 5 April 2012.  Airframe pricing reflects MYP8 contract award on 6 July 2012.

Description:  CC = Common Cockpit
Airframe & Avionics CFE, T.L. and miscellaneous Avionics GFE long lead requirements which are necessary to maintain the MH-60R delivery schedule.  Funding reflects applicable EOQ requirements.

Description.val: Contractor Furnished Equipment (CFE) long lead/EOQ funding procures, via MYP2, the required Mission System Avionics Suite & Common Cockpit (CC) with lead times requiring Advanced Procurement funds.  The MH-60R MYP2 contract does not breakout these items as they are procured as a total mission systems and common cockpit suite.  Government Furnished Equipment (GFE) long lead items include Integrated Mechanical Diagnostics (IMDS), Rate Gyros, Forward Looking Infared (FLIR) Hand Control Units, BRU-14 bomb racks, Cartridge Activiated Devices (CADS), and other miscellaneous avionics requirements (14-27 months PLT) which are necessary to maintain the MH-60R delivery schedule.
